revision.text:
{{no footnotes|date=March 2013}} [[File:Charles Floyd Hatcher.jpg|thumb|Charles Floyd Hatcher]] '''Charles Floyd Hatcher''' (born July 1, 1939) is an [[United States|American]] [[politician]] and [[lawyer]]. He served in Congress as a [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]].
==Biography== Hatcher was born in [[Doerun, Georgia|Doerun]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]] and served in the [[United States Air Force]] from 1958 until 1962. After his military service, he attended [[Georgia Southern University|Georgia Southern College]] in [[Statesboro, Georgia|Statesboro]] in 1965 and then entered the [[University of Georgia]] [[University of Georgia School of Law|School of Law]] in [[Athens, Georgia|Athens]]. Hatcher graduated with a [[Juris Doctor]] degree in 1969, became a member of the state bar, and started practicing law in [[Albany, Georgia]].
Hatcher served in the [[Georgia House of Representatives]] from 1973 to 1980. He was elected to six consecutive terms in the [[United States House of Representatives|U.S. House of Representatives]] beginning with the election of 1980. Hatcher ran an unsuccessful bid for re-election in 1992, losing the Democratic primary to [[Sanford Bishop]], in part because of the [[House banking scandal]].
==References== {{CongBio|H000340}} Retrieved on March 20, 2010
